headline: Salesforce and Adobe Start 2026 With a 5% Plunge—Should Investors Buy or Bail?
summary: It was a nasty year for the software stocks in 2025, as investors pondered the disruptive impact of artificial intelligence (AI). With shares of enterprise software and AI agent innovator Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) and creative software titan Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) starting off the very first trading day of the year with a steep decline, it feels like ... headline: Kahuna Labs Appoints Atul Nanda as Executive Advisor to Guide Product Strategy and Support Industry Engagement
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 06, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Kahuna Labs, the Frontline Productivity Company, today announced that Atul Nanda has joined the company as an Executive Advisor, bringing decades of global leadership experience across customer support, customer success, and enterprise cloud operations at some of the world’s most influential technology companies, including Google, Salesforce, and Atlassian. headline: Assessing Salesforce (CRM) Valuation After Recent AI Jitters And Share Price Weakness
summary: Salesforce (CRM) is back in focus after a sharp 4.26% drop to start 2026, as investors weigh softer enterprise software sentiment against questions about how quickly its AI tools, including Agentforce, can lift growth and margins. See our latest analysis for Salesforce. That 4.26% slide at the start of 2026 extends a tougher year for Salesforce, with a 1 year total shareholder return decline of 20.62% alongside a 3 year total shareholder return of 75.92% and a 90 day share price return of...

headline: AnywhereNow Announces the Sale of IQ Messenger to Main Capital Partners
summary: The sale to Main Capital Partners will drive accelerated international growth for IQ Messenger, whilst allowing AnywhereNow to focus on its core Customer Experience SaaS activities. Rotterdam, Netherlands. 6th January, 2026 - Anywhere365 Group B.V. headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We Keep Off Our Radar
summary: Generating cash is essential for any business, but not all cash-rich companies are great investments. Some produce plenty of cash but fail to allocate it effectively, leading to missed opportunities.

raw.headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We Keep Off Our Radar
